description: Torture Chamber room - a Tier 2 L-shaped room for prisoner extraction, conversion, and Corruption generation with very high fear and adjacency spread

userStories.title: Torture Chamber Room Definition
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Torture Chamber defined in YAML gamedata so that it is available through the content pipeline
acceptanceCriteria: A torture-chamber.yaml file exists in the appropriate gamedata/ directory
Fields include: id, name, description, shape (L-shaped), functions, maxInhabitants, baseFearLevel, adjacencyEffects, upgradePaths
The YAML compiles to valid JSON via npm run gamedata:build
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: L-Shaped Room Placement
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want to place the Torture Chamber as an L-shaped room on the grid
acceptanceCriteria: The Torture Chamber occupies an L-shaped set of tiles
The room can be rotated (4 orientations) during placement
Placement validates that all tiles are unoccupied
Renders correctly on the grid in all orientations
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Information Extraction
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want to extract information from captured prisoners to gain strategic intelligence
acceptanceCriteria: A prisoner can be placed in the Torture Chamber for interrogation
Interrogation takes a defined amount of time
Successful extraction reveals information about invasions, resources, or enemy weaknesses
Extraction requires at least 1 inhabitant assigned as the interrogator
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Prisoner Conversion
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want to convert prisoners into loyal inhabitants to expand my workforce
acceptanceCriteria: A prisoner can be placed in the Chamber for conversion
Conversion takes a defined amount of time (longer than extraction)
Successful conversion transforms the prisoner into a basic inhabitant with -20% efficiency
Conversion has a failure chance (prisoner may die or escape)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Corruption Generation and Spread
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Torture Chamber to generate Corruption and spread it to adjacent rooms
acceptanceCriteria: The Chamber generates a defined amount of Corruption per minute when staffed
Generation increases when a prisoner is being processed
Adjacent rooms gain Corruption over time
Corruption spread rate is defined in gamedata
Spread is removed if the Chamber is demolished
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Very High Fear Level and Fear Spread
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the Torture Chamber to have very high fear that propagates to adjacent rooms
acceptanceCriteria: Base fear level is Very High (4)
Adjacent rooms receive a +1 fear level modifier from the Chamber
Fear modifier stacks with the room's base fear level
Modifier is removed if the Chamber is demolished
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Upgrade Paths
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want three mutually exclusive upgrade paths for the Torture Chamber
acceptanceCriteria: Grand Inquisitor: +50% extraction speed, +25% conversion success rate, capacity increases to 2
Corruption Engine: doubles Corruption generation rate, increases spread to adjacent rooms
Fear Amplifier: fear spread extends to rooms 2 tiles away, invaders in affected rooms suffer combat penalty, fear to Maximum (5)
Each upgrade has a defined resource cost
Choosing one path locks out alternatives at this tier
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Prisoner Management UI
userStories.description: As a dungeon builder, I want a UI to manage prisoners in the Torture Chamber
acceptanceCriteria: The room panel shows current prisoner (if any) and their status
Options to start extraction or conversion are available
Progress bars show current operation progress
Outcome (success/failure) is displayed clearly
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
Typecheck passes
